chapter.pericope: Yahweh Gives Authority to His Messiah

ul.li1: titleOf David. A psalm.The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm
1A declaration of Yahweh to my lord,
until I make your enemies your footstool.”
2Yahweh will send out your mighty scepter from Zion;
rule in the midst of your enemies.
3Your people will volunteerLiterally “will be freewill offerings”; see the related verbal form in Judg 5:2 in the day of your power.Or “day of your army,” or “day of battle”
In holy splendor, from the womb of the dawn,
you will have the dew of your youth.The meaning of this verse is obscure
4Yahweh has sworn and he will not change his mind,
according to the manner of Melchizedek.”
he will shatter kings in the day of his anger.
he will fill them with corpses.
He will shatter the rulersLiterally “head” of many countries.
7He will drink from the stream by the road;
therefore he will lift up his head.
